page.title: 07HINTON PRIORY
page.content: Hinton Priory was founded by the Countess of Salisbury(1232)as a Priory for Carthusian monks.The Prior was in charge of 16 monks;they lived in small cottages,with their own garden,around a cloister square. The other buildings are a chapel,chapter house,a library above ,a refectory and a gatehouse. At the Reformation(1539)the Priory was closed and all properties and buildings were sold. The Gatehouse was enlarged in 1580 into the large present day house,using stone from other buildings.Today the chapterhouse,library and refectory still stand. Today the influence of the Priory is still seen in names.{Friary wood} represents the home of lay workers. The name{Charterhouse}is now linked to {Hinton.
